website_summaries.verdict: Dell's Venue 7 is an inexpensive Android tablet that is upstaged by more capable options from Amazon and Barnes & Noble.
cons: Higher-resolution options are available in the $150 price range

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the size!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned my 2 adult children would not be happy with this smaller tablet, but I was oh so wrong! I bought each of them one for Christmas 2013 and they were super excited. They use them almost non-stop for everything from Facebook to streaming videos and everything in between...and it's a Dell!! They auto-updated as soon as the devices were turned on with super easy setup to our secured wireless! Absolutely no issues/complaints about this product. What more could you ask for??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised that this unit is pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This unit is pretty good for what is designed for and I am not trying to degrade anything about it. Realistically, it may not have the horsepower of some of its much more expensive brethren but for the basic things such as playing games and the like, this unit is not that bad. I was pleasantly surprised. This unit is not going to be used for anything except average games and reading the news and the like so I did not need something with the power of an iPad or a Windows 8 tablet. I was therefore happy to not have to pay iPad prices to do these few things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: winner!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on refurb for $99 and could not be happier. 16 gb is a must have for the kids. The previous Kindle fire had 8gb hd. By the time you subtract 4gb for the OS snd more than 2gb for a Chuggington 3D game, Angry Birds GO! and bundled google apps, it was almost full. I was deleting games daily so ABG and Chug vould have space to update. The 16gb hd effectivly triples useable space compared to an 8gb as you have 12gb after OS comoared to the kindles 4gb. No bundles Google junk or OS overlays like Kindle. Just a clean 4.4.2 kit kat after initial system updates.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Medina

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY DELL!  wifi & restart problem os no upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Have had this tablet for a number of years restarts at random, won't automatically reconnect to home wifi, and the OS will not upgrade. Dell has never offered solutions for restart and wifi connection problems. Dell can't seem to manage OS upgrades, what you buy is all you get. I heard they recently got out of Android tablet market; that good, I don't believe they manufactured good hardware, didn't seem to be able to manage the software , and their support is pathetic. Inept competitors!
customer_reviews.author: michaelgp

customer_reviews.title: and the battery life is pathetic. After a year (of course
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't depend on it for work but for travel entertainment and just having a WIFI-enabled device without paying a data plan, it works. Startup takes forever, and the battery life is pathetic. After a year (of course, once the warranty ended) the USB connector started to get loose and it became very difficult to charge. If the charger (and I've tried several) is not plugged in at the perfect angle with just the right amount of pressure, it won't charge. So overall I'm not too thrilled. Update - My brother was able to fix the charging issue by cleaning out the USB port with some alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: zdevil

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a blackberry playbook, but I'm kinda hooked on android so I finally decided to grab up an android tablet. I'm really only using it fit web browsing, social media & email -rather than turning on the computer or messing with my phone. Have had this 3 days now. Impressively thin & lightweight. Screen resolution is nice & sharp. Screen is responsive - darned near perfect (playbook's is crap.) Like that it has 2G operating RAM. Processor its nice & fast. I did not buy this for the camera -who does??? Overall very pleased with performance. Great for the price & my uses. Great Dell guarantee. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie Burkland

customer_reviews.title: A good Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: One of the best low priced Android tablets out there. Runs KitKat 4.4.2. No word on if Dell will upgrade it to Lollipop. The screen resolution is fine. No need to spend another $100 for higher resolution. Although I have to say that the colors on this thing is a little faded. Battery life seems to be a little light as I tend to charge this quite frequently. The front camera is only 1.3MP and it pretty much shows. One design problem is that the mini USB connector gets stuck at times and is difficult to pull the cord out.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: No good 2018
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product returned because Android play errors it lagged and I couldn't do anything on it. But it's a common issue with Android tablets because of updating and processor not able to advance to the suggest speed of newer updates.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: just needs to fix the "black screen" bug
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet, it's amazing but I'm rating it 3 stars because it has bugs that need fixing like for example I will just be randomly looking at something or watching a video then the screen goes solid black for no reason. I like it because it can automatically update to the latest android firmware and it can screenshot and a ton of apps but I just hate the bug issues. Also the tablet goes black whenever you have a update for an app, I always just turn it off and on to fix that problem but other than the screen going black it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Bain

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7
customer_reviews.text: Orginially, I am a HP junkie, but this Dell is working great for me. I can't say enough good things about it. I had wanted to get a tablet that had a dual camera on it but decided against it because I already have a great canon camera and an excellent camera on my Iphone4. This is easy to use has lots of memory and gets the job done for me. I would recommend it for college students and even professionals who want some simply yet have the capacity to store lots of info. Besides, dell products are depenable and have great warranties.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eason

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet - bad charger connector design
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tablet overall for the price, but I need to point out the issue I have with the charger connection to the tablet. The metal connector end does not fit snugly into the tablet - it is very loose, and is probably a well-known design flaw with this connector style as I have the same issue with another tablet with the same style connector. The problem varies with different connector cords, but it can be very difficult to charge when the connection isn't secure - meaning you think it is charging but it is not. You have to put it in just the right position and verify it on the screen to ensure the charger connection is made.
customer_reviews.author: Solar Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Dell Delivered
customer_reviews.text: I had tried another new tablet brand - unfortunately my kids broke them both - ordered 2 of these - they seem to be more robust in construction for only $10 more (the price had recently been reduced) - and no issues with wifi connectivity(which was a problem with the others), no freezes despite the kids downloading more apps than you could imagine - I was also able to get cases that fit and protect - and am overall pleased and think that these will last a few years (particularly as I ration the kids' use to weekends and holidays only!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tablet until the display died. It didn't even last a year and of course the warranty doesn't last that long either. I suppose this is why they push extended warranties, because they know that even though most products never need the warranty (meaning that it is pure profit for them) sometimes they do need them because the regular warranties they offer are not long enough. The display failure is very disappointing considering Dell usually produces good stuff. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Rene M.

customer_reviews.title: I love this, it was my first tablet.
customer_reviews.text: the Battery goes down with in a day. Other wise its great. I has a dell badge on it. I assume it was made in china, Dell made a good move on that one. I have replace the battery and its still going, wifi is not as good a it used to be. Its been used a lot! I don' t know when I bought it, still trying to dig that up. But its a keeper
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GREAT GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I was on the fence about getting a windows based tablet, but decided i would give the Jelly Bean tablet a shot. Was i sure surprised!!!! the apps available give me all the accessibility i need to remote access my office and do whatever i need to do (office, excel, project, even some low level CAD!!!). The 2GBRAM really makes a difference and this thing runs smoothly. I would really like to see it with the KitKat system, but for the price, you really cannot beat it. I was torn between this and a few other competitorss, but if computing is important, the extra RAM makes a WORLD of difference. BRAVO!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LEWS THERIN

customer_reviews.title: dell tablet
customer_reviews.text: First time tablet, got it to use with the square card reader for sales. Easy to figure out how to find settings, etc. I'm not a techy person, but seems easy. Got son-in-law to load apps on, so have no idea about that. He however has "tablet envy" and likes this better than his. I looked at a Lenovo tablet too, cost less, but the headphone jack and the power point were too close together to have square card reader plugged in and the power cord at same time. Hence, the dell.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Dalberto

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tablet, especially for the price. It streams no problem, and it small enough for me to play games on my N64 emulator, with minimal problems. I like it way better than my iPad, though the battery life isn't near as long. If I'm using it quite a bit it will last about a day and a half, and if I'm streaming a lot, then it will last about a day. But overall all, it costs a lot less than my iPad, it as expandable storage, it's faster than my iPad, and I like the android operating system a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Corie H.

customer_reviews.title: Dell venue vs Asus Memo
customer_reviews.text: I had only a little over $100 to spend to get a tablet and I don't like wasting money. Like I did on a Dragon touch. I look at the asus Memo as for my second choice. I Choice the Venue because of the 2 gbs of ram. Although the ram is only ddr2 it is still twice as much storage for all my Chrome tabs. The Memo also has a quad core. Why would a tablet need a quad core? The Venue has high clock speed with turbo boost with two cores. It was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Super glitchy. I should have returned right away because ...
customer_reviews.text: Super glitchy. I should have returned right away because it was packaged like it was refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet but not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that it wasn't set up to do what I needed. It is an older model and I didn't think about that when ordering. I have had the same model in previous years and liked it very well. Unfortunately I just need a more advanced model. I'm sorry I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Magcarp

customer_reviews.title: HELP! Anyone w/ experience or advice?
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet 2 years ago. I love love it. All of a sudden it would not charge, but I don't think it's the battery. I know it's not the charger because I use it on other devices. It seems like the trouble is the connector on the device. It seems loose, or not connected inside. Does anyone have advice, or suggestions? Is it fixable without a huge pricetag? I really love this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: OC Tita

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pleased
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pleased with the tablet. I was not sure what to expect given the low end price point. Emails, internet, apps from Google play, music/speakers, typing, touch sensitivity of the screen, brightness/contrast, weight, battery charge (speed and holding), internet/bluetooth connection, ability to attach wired keyboard using OTG - all work just as advertised. No complaints. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ramkumar

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 7 year old to replace lost Samsung Galaxy Tab. Screen is not as good as Samsung, but it's ok. Operating system is pretty much stock Android so no unnecessary customizations. I like plenty of memory, so far it hasn't been filled by my son (big problem with Galaxy) The only thing I don't like about this tablet is that it takes forever to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Janicki

customer_reviews.title: We had one before and has lasted 5 years through ...
customer_reviews.text: We had one before and has lasted 5 years through falls and multiple games. We needed a second one for another child who also wants games on his tablet. We use it for games and movies only.
customer_reviews.author: proud parent

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet but had to return
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was performing nicely, good picture, camera was taking good photos for a tablet of it's price range. After a few days use, the charger connection (mini usb port) on the tablet would not connect and allow the battery to charge. I tried another charger and cable, same results. End result, unit was working nicely but had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Gourley

customer_reviews.title: Started out good
customer_reviews.text: This was a really nice tablet until Dell updated the Android version. Now it constantly crashes and is unreliable to operate. It has to be rebooted all the time and if the browser is used it will almost immediately fail so have to use Chrome. So far there does not appear to be a fix for this issue and apparently it cannot be downgraded to the previous version. This was a gift for my wife and she is very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ilpedrino

customer_reviews.title: Quirky tablet but works well.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is weak but that's not what you buy a tablet for. It works fine but has some quirks but the price is right. At the price Amazon listed this tablet at purchase it made sense. My wife uses it as a second screen lounging around. The screen is ok, memory and speed are all ok. Nothing outstanding but at the price, its a value.
customer_reviews.author: Jared The Geek

customer_reviews.title: Good little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my husband after one of our friends bought one. He uses it every day and loves it. I've also used it on occasion and found it to be a good little tablet. It's fast, actually faster than my much higher priced big name brand tablet. I haven't found anything about this tablet to complain about. The price is great and it'll do pretty much anything you would want/expect a tablet to do. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: dhamm

customer_reviews.title: this is a good quality 7" Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: Not up to date with Android KitKat, which is why I'll be buying another one...KitKat stops your ability to store anything on the SD card...this is a good quality 7" Android tablet, 2GBs ram, not up to the Samsung tablet line screen quality, but works for me, even w/photo edit. Much better than Contixio or Levono tablets in speed, screen, or ram (I have one of each)...can't beat the price for what you get...
customer_reviews.author: Dana M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Really great
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this is perfect. The processing speed is good. I listen to jango and the music sounds very good. It is very bright at night so its good for night reading. Overall it is a great product and good buy. The negatives include the fact there are software that I will never use that keep updating. without the option to stop the auto updates s lot of storage will be sucked up.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional tablet
customer_reviews.text: Out family has owned 3 Kindle Fire tablets and has been very pleased with them. When my husband suggested that we try this Dell tablet for one of the kids, I was a bit skeptical. However, it's a great tablet ... with a great design and functions. We liked it so good that we've already purchased a second Dell tablet. This is a great tablet at a great price. This has definitely been money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: korakas

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best tablet available if you are on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This is not an iPad but for the price of it, it handles it all very well I must say. If you are thinking of buying a chinese tablet for a little less money ($100) please don't, you will regret it and it's not worth it. The touch screen is very precise and it hardly gives any issues for general use. It's very responsive with high quality materials and construction. The screen and colors are not too vivid for my taste and the battery can be a little bit on the short side, but I can't really compare it to others in the same price range/specs. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7 Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive tablet and the Dell Venue 7 fit the bill perfectly. I already have a Samsung Galaxy S4 Android phone and needed something with a larger screen. I've had the Venue 7 for about 6 weeks and am very satisfied with it. The only minor complaint is that it will only play about 99.5 percent of the Android games and apps. I definitely recommend it if you're looking for an inexpensive Android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Eberth, SCPO, USCG, Ret

customer_reviews.title: Liked the tablet
customer_reviews.text: Liked the tablet, especially the back feather type body of it which is soft and feels good to hold. Needed it mostly for running the ebooks that I have. Gave it a 4 star as I have already used ipads and no ways does it compete with it. Also even with so much of ram, its still a little bit slow. But this hardly matters to me as I am only gonna read ebooks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Krish

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I am having so much fun with this tablet. I am elderly and was worried that I wouldn't get the hang of it without a lot of effort, but it is a delight to use! I'm enjoying books, news articles, email, and many other features. My only regret is that I didn't get a 10-inch. Didn't realize I'd be using it so much.
customer_reviews.author: MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: It's great having a true Android tablet that can be rooted ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid Android tablet. This is the second in the family, and we are traditionally an all Mac household. Minimal apps installed, not filled with a bunch of Dell branded junkware. Handles all tasks effortlessly. It's great having a true Android tablet that can be rooted with superior hardware at a hundred buckaroos. Unfortunately Dell has moved on to windows 8, so this one will likely be gone soon.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's very good
customer_reviews.text: The Dell Venue 7 looks like most of the chinese tablets coming out these days - it is indeed made in China. The specs are really excellent for a tablet that is less than 140$. Good speed, decent multitasking. Nice touch screen. The speaker is actually pretty good. I've had a glitch or two, but mostly no problems at all and have been using it daily for a month. Great size when you are on the go. The HD screen is very nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tablet I love it...
customer_reviews.text: I love it does everything I need it to do. Nice sharp picture, games run extremely well on this tablet. All the apps I had on my last tablet loaded quickly on this tablet from the play store. I love the larger flash drive to my last tablet only had like a 4gb and this one has a 16gb. Very light tablet to easy to hold on to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for the hubby. He loved it and the teen in the house would steal it when Dad wasn't looking so she could play on it, even though she had a laptop. Her laptop got killed in an unfortunate accident, and she went right out and got one of these. Hubby plays games, teen watches movies/YouTube. Great resolution, fast, and the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: LKS

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: USB charge port failed in 3 weeks-loose internal hardware. Thank goodness for Square Trade allowing for a refund. I believe Dell could do a better job with manufacturing standards-although the price point for this device is on the lower end. Hard to recommend given the concern for longevity and performance. I would recommend paying a little more for better quality devices.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7 tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tablet and found that I was able to get it at a very reasonable price. I also received it prior to the promised delivery date. I am very happy with its performance and easiness in operation.
customer_reviews.author: dpol

customer_reviews.title: Good specs for a cheaper laptop for it's time
customer_reviews.text: Good specs for a cheaper laptop for it's time, my one big negative I have with it is if the screen is damaged it stops working from the crack on down, most modern phones and tablets are now designed so even if the screen is smashed into 50 pieces the touch screen still works, not on this model...
customer_reviews.author: D. Marchand

customer_reviews.title: Best in class!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my seventeen year old who killed his laptop and was looking at tablets vs laptops. He can do a lot of what he could on a laptop and more with all of the apps available. He still uses our laptop for word processing but he is really happy with this tablet for surfing the web and playing games and he can take it a lot more places than a laptop. We have several other tablets around the same price range and this one is by far the best in its class. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: kristin mccann

customer_reviews.title: worked great for the first couple of days then the external ...
customer_reviews.text: worked great for the first couple of days then the external speakers stopped working. It makes kinda hard to listen to music or audio books and I bought it for that reason. Gonna try & exchange it. If that one dies then I'll try a different inexpensive tablet.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. I'm an apple product user and was new to an android system. It is a bit slow after a lot of use but it's cheap and worth the price. I use it for games and online shopping which is all I need. The front and back camera are pretty sucky so if you're looking for something that takes quality pictures, this isn't for you. The sound quality is alright.
customer_reviews.author: MarieC

customer_reviews.title: I had to send it back 3 times to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it back 3 times to get fixed. This last time was after the warranty expired so nothing can be done unless I pay for it. They don't even have an instruction manual available online. You can't take it apart to try to fix it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Domino.4212

customer_reviews.title: Great Android Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the brand fool you this is tablet is running AOSP Android with little customizations added on by Dell. It is running version 4.2. I bought it for my mom for Christmas and she loves it. The camera is a no frills camera but get's the job done for video chatting via the Hangouts app. Overall would recommend it to anyone looking for a solidly built budget android tablet running native Android.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great price and tablet
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tablet. It was a great price and it does the trick for what I need it for- mostly surfing the net. The only thing that I don't like is that it isn't compatible with Amazon Instant Video, which really sucks because I wanted to watch movies on it from Amazon. Overall, good purchase. Would recommend. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: tablet fine, but cord could be much better.
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is great. Would prefer a slightly larger screen but this is perfect for slipping into a purse. The power cord did not last long. Five months later and the part that connects to the tablet is loose, so it can be plugged in all night and then I find in the morning that it hasn't charged.
customer_reviews.author: Duchess

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift but since I own one myself, I know it works very well. It's another option out there in the marketplace to choose from. It does everything that my iPad does and there are a lot of apps that can be downloaded. Not to mention - the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Pat V.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I dont give it 5 star because after I tried the Asus Memo Pad173 I cant give this one the 5 stars.. But let me say that this tablet is really good for the price. Ive had for a year now and is still working really good. Battery life is not the best but for the price is a good gift for a kid. I bought it for my 6 yr old boy who destroys everything and tablet still alive so that should count for something. If you cant spend a lot of money on a tablet this is a safe choice
customer_reviews.author: Antoynette

customer_reviews.title: Met the expectations ;)
customer_reviews.text: Received the product like a new one. Everything is working almost good. Sometimes screen will freeze when you don't use it for long time and also when you keep over night extra hour charging. It will come to normal when you power off and then on. I don't mind it unless it freezes when I'm using it. I play marvels 'contest of champions' game. In that game all graphics are not coming and I could see dotted pixels on the screen. But we can play without any lags that is what I liked the most. Performance while browsing apps is too fast. Overall it is a good buy. I'm happy with it :)
customer_reviews.author: sivaram bondada

customer_reviews.title: Dedicated Tablet for 3DR Solo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a used Venue 7 for use as a dedicated screen for a 3DR Solo drone. Works perfectly for intended purpose and the price made it the cheapest tablet option. GPS was a necessary feature, and the 7 inch screen size is about perfect for the Solo controller
customer_reviews.author: Matt Headlee

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting so much for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily cause it was cheap, and I just wanted a tablet to play games on. I use to have a Nexus 7 (2012) edition, but I dropped it, so I bought this as a replacement. Turns out it works just as good as my old Nexus 7 (2012) edition or even better. There is no lagging, and the graphics while playing games are amazing. Only thing I didn't like was the front facing camera, it's kind of blurry when I use it. Overall it's definitely one of the best tablets for less then $200.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anibal Alanis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my Mom for Christmas. She loves it!! She learned how to use it very quickly. It the perfect size too. You can easily put it in your purse or bag. Its fast and user friendly. I definitely recommend this tablet. And at $150, its a super great deal!!
customer_reviews.author: StephanieLynn

customer_reviews.title: A Gift of the Future
customer_reviews.text: We ordered Two for Grandchildren. The are saying there approval. This was a good choice for them. We picked them for there reliability. We looked for Ruggedness. We looked for their leading to better school work. Very nice presentation. Read buyers review at Website.
customer_reviews.author: David Alexander Smathers

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, who is not a gadget or tech person. She used the thing religiously, mostly for games and browsing. The Wi-Fi engages instantaneously and the touchscreen is intuitively responsive. Construction is solid and the battery life is excellent. I hope the jerk who stole it is enjoying it immensely.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cusick

customer_reviews.title: Works so far.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: no crashes first month of use, low price, good for basic computing needs, like the rubberized case. Cons: short battery life, poor cameras, tinny speaker. It's still a step up from tablets at the low end of the scale... I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: F. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet with lots of memory and specs
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Can still download kindle app and have all my books, etc., and have 16 GB memory and loads of other apps from the google app store. Great deal for the price. Would never buy an ipad or even a Samsung - just think they are overpriced. Dell all the way - and first one I've ever purchased. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7 -16 gig
customer_reviews.text: For the price it can't be beat. Not the fastest processor, but the 2 gigs of ram make it load faster with less glitches than faster processors and 1 gig of ram. Very thin and light. I love how it for inside my suit breast pocket or in my pants front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a great price
customer_reviews.text: My 6-year-old daughter lost her iPod touch so I decided to replace it with a 7" tablet. After shopping around, this looked like the best option. It was cheaper than buying another iPod, with a larger screen, expandable memory with the Micro SD slot and the same battery life. She loves the tablet and has no interest in another iPod touch. Great product from Dell!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: fast and good graphics
customer_reviews.text: Love it have not had it long enough to figure out all the functions it does what I expected it to do . For me it's a new learning curve on how to use the android system. getting apps is a curve for me I cannot figure out how to cancel pages searched the net nothing shows up so still have a long way to go.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother as gift, she still loves it
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: i am satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this product i think it is perfect for what i use it for so for this being my first tablet it is definetly a winner plus it in my budget under a 150 which was a plus so i would definetly recommend this tablet to anyone on a budget Plus its pretty stylish for what its worth
customer_reviews.author: C.A.T,thewritter

customer_reviews.title: It has worked fine since I bought it and it met all of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February because my last tablet died. It has worked fine since I bought it and it met all of my expectations. However, last week the touchscreen started acting strange. It would zoom when touched with one finger among other strange issues. It acts like a touch screen that has water on it. I have not dropped the tablet so it shouldn't be suffering from some damage because of that. It is a shame that after only four months I am yet again looking for a new tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Michel R. Baril

customer_reviews.title: I am still using my tablet today great product. I would have to say that there ...
customer_reviews.text: I am still using my tablet today great product. I would have to say that there are some things that aren't supported on it, but if you need a good tablet to have around the house for video and fun this would be your tablet. Please make sure you put it in a casing, my husband broke that portion, go figure, but anyway it was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Angela P.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Initially purchased the ASUS at $130 despite reading complains of not working after the first or second recharge. But it happened to me 3 times. I returned it and reluctantly bought the Dell Venue as it was higher priced ($150) with similar specs. So far, the Dell has worked very well. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: OORev

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet for the Value
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by this tablet. I was skeptical to buy a Dell brand machine because they haven't always had the best products, but I was blown away by this one. I shopped around for quite a bit but couldn't find a better deal for these specs. With 2G RAM and a 1.6GHz processor, this lil guy is very fast. YouTube videos load practically instantly and I am able to stream live video from the Twitch.tv app without lag. I paid $118.99 on sale and I still think it would be an outstanding deal at $150.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Filip

customer_reviews.title: Not a pc replacement
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd Dell Venue. Got the first from Dell and it's excellent. This one appears to be also. For searching the Internet, email and most games it's a fantastic deal. It doesn't have a huge storage ability so if you're looking for a pc replacement go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Papajim

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this device!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a tablet. I love this one. It has helped in numerous ways to help me keep my business organized with a few useful apps.I got a great NIB price. It glitched after a week, seemed to come out of it & has been fine ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Coupe DeVille

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet for a very good price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this one for my dad who decided he needed a tablet. I thought on buying a 7 inch and the price tag on this one was very attractive, and I wanted to try an Intel powered tablet. I have to say I am pretty impressed with this little one, when I compare it with my old Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0+ system. Screen looks great, no issues so far using it, and for the things that my father wants to use it for is more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Aguilar R

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Kindle Fire With This
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Battery seems to last longer. More apps available (google play store). Would recommend over the original Fire.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: While it isn't the cheapest tablet on the market and it isn't a highend product; it is stable, consistent and does what I need/want. I think the android OS Jellybean is a wonderful improvement to Windows CE.
customer_reviews.author: tangelheart

customer_reviews.title: has nice screen, and decent performance
customer_reviews.text: Been used and abused by two kids (ages 7 and 3). Charges a bit slowly, but once charged it keeps a charge for fairly long time, has nice screen, and decent performance. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JGN

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7 16 GB Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love the clear picture, but it a little overy touchy and my apps change to quickly, that might be great for a 15 year age person, for me I like it not to be so touchy why 4 stars, I also love it cause I can climb into bed yet still go online. thank great product.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in great condition but the screen is cracked and never does it mention any of this in the description. Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a 10" tablet that had 1gb mem. This one is smaller but I actually like the size better than the 10". The screen is clear and easy to read. The speed of the tablet is great for my uses. Mainly I want something to do some quick email reading and surfing the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Happy with them
customer_reviews.text: purchased one for each child. Still going strong. Does everything we wanted it to. Has plenty of power. They can take to school on media day. Play games at home. Talk to friends on social formats. Happy with them. No cons.
customer_reviews.author: Marge R

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tablet
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tablet. Very little bloat-wear (preloaded apps) The screen doesn't seem as touch sensitive as my Samson tablet, so It's taken time to get used to. At first Amazon's Music App didn't work on it. After a few calls to Amazon the problem seems to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Dell Venue 7 16 GB Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I like My Venue 7 very much; I purchase this tablet to use away from home, so I would not have to carry my laptop with me and its great in so many ways, communication, searching, directions, games, shopping, and much more, I am still learning how to use it, Would I recommend it to someone else? Yes I would. I am very happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: erma l.johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: Dell seems to have resurrected itself into the modern era with new devices and is proving that a quality product does not have to be expensive. I cannot say anything bad about this tablet, it works as well as the others for much less. This really holds its own.
customer_reviews.author: Xander

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tablet. It has a clean android platform and it includes an update to 4.3 which works real smooth. It's simply great for everyday basic use with no issues to report. Update 5/15: Dell venue 7 still working well and now has an update to android 4.4!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: good battery life
customer_reviews.text: got it for a beginner . they still use it does everything they need. good battery life .gps is great for map apps.no more separate gps devise. has not locked up.
customer_reviews.author: ugotit

customer_reviews.title: Am I Glad I Bought This One!
customer_reviews.text: For comparison I have only had one other tablet, and that was a big disappointment because it did not have Google Playstore, but I have to say I think the Venue 7 is absolutely wonderful. I admire everything about it. It charges quickly and holds a charge for a long time; the screens/images are clear and sharp; it's light and easy to handle and operate; perfect for swiping credit cards. To me it's like magic.
customer_reviews.author: Artsy-crafty

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a tablet until this Dell Venue and I'm very impressed how well the quality is and how fast this tablet functions. Easy set-up and also has an external SD card reader. Great deal compared to other prices on tablets.
customer_reviews.author: santanarg

customer_reviews.title: Worked when we got it, but now I cannot ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked when we got it, but now I cannot get it to work and even tried to reset it. Will have to take more time and see if it is salvageable.
customer_reviews.author: holly

customer_reviews.title: Dell venue 7
customer_reviews.text: This product was advertised as having a SIM Card slot. It does not have one, even though it is designated in the accompanying Quick Start Guide diagram of the unit. The unit itself is good quality but I would have preferred it with a SIM Card capability.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K.

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My technologically challenged wife streams her Vietnamese TV series and music with her Venue and uses it every day since I bought it for her in December. It was a good deal at $149. I'd give it more stars if it had broadband but then it would have cost much more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Fastner

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter who is 7. She's had it for a year now and its working fine. I bought the warranty simply because she is so young and kids are kids. Havent had to use it yet
customer_reviews.author: Errin C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good for light gaming and surfing only
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over a year. It is a sturdy table but is a let down to not play any of the more resource heavy games such as SW:KotOR, Chao Rings II, or X-COM.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Dell Venue 7
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it holds a 64 sd card inside.. I like that. The only thing I don't like is no instructions, although dell on the phone has been great. What they do not say is that it comes with very few apps. You have to download the apps you want from the play store. They say it eliminates having a bunch of apps you do not want on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this almost a hear now and my 7 year old daughter loves it! Great value and addresses all of our tablet needs. USB charger is great rather than other brands that use manufacturer specific power plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Holland

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet! I would hold off from buying or upgrading to the new ultra HD version of the Dell Venue 7 or 8.... It's very buggy and the new android OS I not backwards compatible with some apps...
customer_reviews.author: Dive2277

customer_reviews.title: It's really fast, but..
customer_reviews.text: It has some 'critical problem' of screen cracked. I mean, not the physical screen, but graphic is often crashed while watching Youtube movie. unfortunately, had to return... but it was very fast and touch works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like it. Battery would die too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it. Battery would die too quickly. Switched to Samsung which was an improvement even though I have a Dell laptop and a Dell desktop. Not too thrilled with this tablet though.
customer_reviews.author: David Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Dell Android Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Many Apps available and many functions to use. It was a gift for my wife and she is pleased with how easy it is to learn how to customize it for herself.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nicotri

customer_reviews.title: TABLET
customer_reviews.text: I like the tablet, but the sound sicks. My cell phone speaker is way louder than that. I really don't like the charging either, i seems to take to long to charge and the camera is awful the pic look fuzzy. I think i will pay alittle more and get something better.

customer_reviews.title: It is by far the best gift she has received according to her
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves loves loves her tablet. It is by far the best gift she has received according to her. We are a family of Dell users anyway so we knew that going with Dell was the way to go. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Erica Moss

customer_reviews.title: Sweet and simple tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little tablet. I have one for each of my 2 children and it's simple enough for them to operate. They love adding games on their own! I can't really speak to the technical aspects of this tablet though, just that it's very easy start up straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: SaraMarie

customer_reviews.title: A good little tablet at a good little price
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a surprisingly good value! At $150, this little table not only offers Wireless Display, but a very comparable battery life to other more expensive tablets. Having used this tablet now for several weeks, the only downside I've encountered is the aforementioned battery life, but I'd have that with almost every tablet of this size. The Dell Venue 7 seems sturdy enough for a responsible user, while being supported by a decent company which has a history of offering reasonable customer service. While I cannot speak to the next generation of these tablets from Dell, I can say that this unit is great for a first time tablet user.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

product_meta.title: Dell Venue 7 16 GB Tablet (Android)
product_meta.description:
This lightweight new tablet features a beautiful 7" HD touch screen. Gather your friends for wide-angle viewing in the palm of your hand.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 16 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars794 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
